Author: thr0wawaynametaken
Text: this happened to me everytime i started refeeding in a hospital; it doesn't happen to everyone but it's pretty common! usually at first  your body will gain bc of the slowed metabolism but after a short time of consistent nutrition it will (the theory is) start burning through the energy you give it very very quickly to repair the damage that's been done to it, meaning that you need more and more to gain. i've been on 3,700 calorie plans and seen people on higher. it's wild, lol.

Author: WilmaVilma
Text: I think I may have had that when I was weight restoring last time? Like I was eating 3000-4000 calories a day and it took me like 3 months to gain 10 pounds even though I was really sedentary (could only go on short walks with my mum)
